It would be nice if the large fairings split (vertically) in three parts instead of two, or, even better, the option to choose how many parts the fairing splits into.

Also, a problem with large fairings is that the game likes to eject them from the bottom rather than at the top, and with no way of adding sepratrons on the fairings, the top of the fairings could end up hitting the accelerating rocket below.

One of the Devs seems to have commented on this issue in the Squadcast Summary thread.

They first commented on how Fairing debris would work.

> 
> I know this with pretty good accuracy and reliability, so I'll answer this.
> The fairings are set up like the broken solar panels are. When seperated, the fairings are not created as traditional vessel debris - this understandably means that having lots of little fairing segments breaking off isn't as much of a performance hit as it would be if they were debris.

As for if Fairings would split into a bunch of pieces like they currently do:

> 
> Currently, yes. Will they in a release version? We will have to see.

I support this. Very much. 

The proposed multipart sep makes me think that squad watched the lost in space movie way many times. Which would be once.

> 
> Heres the thing for me. When I stage the nuke engine and the 2 bits of outer shell fly away, twirling slowly like the last two leaves from a maple tree in November, It looks awesome, and I feel cool. 
> But If I pop the fairing off of my new satellite, and It looks like I'm surrounded by dozens of schoolkids failed paper-mache projects, I dont think I will feel so cool.

The nuke engine faring is an interstage, it either break up in 2-3 parts like the nuclear engine faring or its just left on lower stage as on most shorter engines. 

Hopefully we can use the new farings as inter stage ones too and not have faring on the nuclear engines, they are mostly used with 2.5 meter or larger parts anyway and often grouped. 

Else I agree that faring parts should stay together, it looks far better and would also be safer. You might want to drop it during burn if you have an upper stage with low twr. 

Not sure how hard making the parts stay together would be but think it should be doable. separation edge just horizontally and on edges.

In all honesty, I have to agree that the fairings could use some changes with separation..

But let's not turn it into a bashing flamewar against Squad. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
No flames here, I'm a big fan of Squad and this game.
I would like the two part separation. It feels natural.

Pointing to a real life example, Soyuz has a fairing that is split both horizontally and vertically. Vertical splits during an abort. Horizontal during a regular launch. Note it does not split into 4 pieces - not on purpose anyway.
Confetti fairings look bad. Two-piece clamshell, please.

I said this on my blog and I think it's appropriate to say it again here:

With the overhauled aerodynamics and all the features and parts that come with it, I literally have no reason to run any mods anymore, maybe other than one or two beautification mods and small things like KAS and Chatterer.

I'm also really pleased that the loading time for a stock install has been cut down to less than half of what it is currently, with all the optimisations Squad has done.

The only thing that's stopping this from being perfect is the weird fairing separation, but from looking through this thread, it looks as though it's being sorted out. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
I support proper fairings.
